intro: Syringodea pura, commonly known as the white-flowered syringodea, is a member of the family Rubiaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its flowers have four petals and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Syringodea pura is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
